required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Baby Item Learning and Development Study
clinical_study.official_title: Baby Item Learning and Development Study

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to experimentally test whether baby items can promote healthy infant development.

primary_outcome.measure: Cognitive skill as assessed via eye tracking
primary_outcome.description: Cognitive skill is reported as the percentage of accuracy of eye gaze as evaluated via the eye tracking procedure.

Mother and infant will engage in a 15-minute unstructured free playtime. This engagement will be videotaped and assessed by the Investigator. Parental engagement is reported as the percentage of parental sensitivity and synchrony scored on a 0-100% scale with the higher score indicating increased sensitivity and synchrony.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant Reactivity (Crying) assessed by the Face to Face/Still Face Procedure
primary_outcome.description: Infant emotions and social engagement is reported as the time noted when the infant was crying during the 6 minute Face to Face/Still Face Procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Infant Reactivity (Smiling) assessed by the Face to Face/Still Face Procedure
primary_outcome.description: Infant emotions and social engagement is reported as the time noted when the infant was smiling during the 6 minute Face to Face/Still Face Procedure.
Mother and infant oxytocin levels will be measured via saliva sample.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of infant and adult vocalizations time will be assessed via 2-8 hours audio recordings on LENA.
Percentage of infant and adult turn taking will be assessed via 2-8 hours audio recordings on LENA. Turn taking is defined as the verbal exchange by adult and infant.

primary_outcome.description: Percentage of infant crying time will be assessed via 2-8 hours audio recordings on LENA.

arm_group.description: Participants in the group will be receiving a baby bouncer for use from infant's birth up to 8 months after birth.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Baby Bouncer Group with Infant T-Shirt with LENA
arm_group.description: A subsample of the participants in the baby bouncer group will also receive infant t-shirts with wearable audio recorders.
Participants in the group will be receiving a baby carrier for use from infant's birth up to 8 months after birth.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Baby Carrier Group with Infant T-Shirt with LENA
arm_group.description: A subsample of the participants in the baby carrier group will also receive infant t-shirts with wearable audio recorders.

intervention.arm_group_label: Baby Bouncer Group with Infant T-Shirt with LENA

intervention.intervention_name: Infant t-shirts with Language Environment Analysis (LENA) audio recorders
intervention.description: Infant t-shirts with wearable LENA audio recorders for 2-8 hours of recordings of vocal interaction, crying and turn-taking.
intervention.arm_group_label: Baby Bouncer Group with Infant T-Shirt with LENA
Baby Carrier Group with Infant T-Shirt with LENA
Baby Carrier Group with Infant T-Shirt with LENA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mothers and their infants must be healthy with no known birth complications
- Infants must be born full term (at least 37 weeks gestation)
- Mother must speak English
- Mothers must be at least 28 weeks along in their pregnancy. Mothers with newborns who are less than 2 weeks will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants who does not meet all the inclusion criteria.
